French existentialist philosopher, writer, social theorist, and feminist activist. Wrote on existentialism, ethics, and feminism. Author of The Second Sex, a foundational text of feminist philosophy.

first-international.d: Co-founder of the German Social Democracy with Wilhelm Liebknecht in 1869. Part of the Reichstag from 1867. Outstandingly argued for the emancipation of women's rights before capitalism could be overthrown.
French Poet, member of the First International, Communard, author of The Internationale.
German socialist, contemporary and critic of Marx.
German Revolutionary, comrade of Marx in the Communist League in the 1840s.
After fighting in the 1848 Revolution in Germany, he fled to America; later Secretary of the First International; Marx's closest supporter in the US.

German philosopher, social scientist, journalist, and businessman. Co-founder of Marxism with Karl Marx. Best known for his contributions to revolutionary theory and his support of the working-class movement.

Fought for Irish independence from England. Detailed the atrocities against Irish political prisoners in England. Braved a narrow escape from France after the massacres of the Paris Commune. Marx's eldest daughter.
German communist, supported Marx in the International and in British trade unions.

Created dialectical materialism independently of Marx & Engels, but on seeing their writings became their most ardent supporter. His main contributions were using dialectics to elaborate epistemology.
French socialist. Leader of the Marxist wing of the French workers' movement.

German philosopher, economist, and revolutionary socialist. Co-founder of Marxism and author of Das Kapital and the Communist Manifesto. Developed the theory of historical materialism and critique of political economy.
Co-founders of Marxism and key figures in the First International. Marx drafted the foundational documents of the International Working Men's Association.
French Marxist who moved to the US and joined a forerunner of DeLeon's Socialist Labor Party
A member of the Paris Commune. Staunch advocate of Women's rights, wrote also on the history of religion, morals, literature, language, and comedy. Married to Marx's second daughter, Laura.
French utopian who published a Democratic Manifesto in 1847. Member of First International and Paris Commune
German Revolutionary, comrade of Marx in the Communist League in the 1840s.

frankfurt-school.d: Marxist thinker and theorist in the tradition of frankfurt school.
Marxist thinker and theorist in the tradition of frankfurt school.
German-American philosopher, sociologist, and political theorist associated with the Frankfurt School. Developed critical theory and was a major influence on the New Left movements of the 1960s.
Marxist thinker and theorist in the tradition of frankfurt school.
Marxist thinker and theorist in the tradition of frankfurt school.
Marxist thinker and theorist in the tradition of frankfurt school.
German philosopher, sociologist, psychologist, musicologist, and composer. Co-founder of the Frankfurt School. Developed critical theory and wrote extensively on culture, music, and aesthetics.
German Jewish philosopher, cultural critic and essayist. Associated with the Frankfurt School. Wrote on art, literature, history, and modernity. Influential in aesthetic and Marxist theory.

Marxist thinker and theorist in the tradition of french left.

French existentialist philosopher, playwright, novelist, screenwriter, political activist, biographer, and literary critic. Combined existentialism with Marxism and wrote extensively on freedom and responsibility.
Marxist thinker and theorist in the tradition of french left.
Marxist thinker and theorist in the tradition of french left.

French Marxist philosopher. Developed the theory of structural Marxism and made major contributions to debates on ideological state apparatuses, overdetermination, and the epistemological break in Marx's thought.
Marxist thinker and theorist in the tradition of french left.

Cuban revolutionary and politician who served as the Prime Minister of Cuba and President of Cuba. Led the Cuban Revolution and established the first communist state in the Western Hemisphere.
